noun.description: An alphabetical list of the words (especially the important ones) present in a text, usually with citations of the passages concerned.

examples: the concordance between the teams' research results

noun.description: The inheritance by two related individuals (especially twins) of the same genetic characteristic, such as susceptibility to a disease.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from medieval Latin concordantia, from concordant- being of one mind (see concordant).
